page.title: 08GEORGE A CITIZEN OF ASHBY
page.content: GENERAL STRIKE.{ When he was 14,he went to a grammer school.His dad worked on the dock's in Liverpool.Most of the people he knew were in the shipping business and the fight was over wages.It was the only time in British history that there has been a general strike.If a man wouldn't work the government wouldn't pay him.The union at that time paid 2s 6p if there was a strike.Relative to what George was saying,in those days,the wage for a man on the docks was Â£1 10s.Food was rather cheap.The issue was so important to the working man that the strike lasted 3 to 4 months.The only force that kept on working was the police force,they kept order when there were demonstrations.
